comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
"Heigh-ho, Heigh-ho,  It's home from work we go ... "

I bet it was a Saturday ...  in winter ...

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: Yes, it seems rather curiously dated New Year's Eve.   But the deciduous trees are bare, so I doubt it.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/mich2009] Hi Mich -  We standardise our date formats to read dd/mm/yyyy. If only the year the photo was taken is known we say "year only" before the date but retain the dd/mm/yyyy format using the last day of the year to fill in the unknown day and month.
